content.description: Start on the left side of the dark slab under the Mammoth Eye. Climb up and right through a weakness, then move directly up the slab.
content.location: Climbs a central line up the Mammoth Head

content.description:
Start same as "Run You Bastard" then cut left up a crack/weakness and climb up onto a rest. Moving left over the Mammoth Eye and up into the crack is the psychological crux. Cross the big fissure to chains up and left.

This is a fun route, and is not as hard as it looks, but it is a bit heady.
content.protection: A couple small TCU's are recommended, bolts.

climbs.name: Hold the Rope
climbs.fa: C. Lattimer and E. Wolfe. May 2020. (Prior TR by Jason Stevens)

content.description:
Climb an unprotectable slab to a seam about 20' up. Follow the seam and crack to a two bolt anchor.

This climb can also be accessed by first climbing one of the other two routes on the formation or scrambling around the back side. This route makes a good TR.
content.protection: Single rack. Offset nuts and cams. Cahones.
content.location: Located approximately 20' right of the anchors on the big ledge at the top of "Run, you Bastard!".

content.description: This is a good route but the pro is hard. Ascend the right-leaning crack that intersects the slab.
content.location: To get to the base of this route scramble up between the Mammoth Head And Mammoth body.

climbs.name: Corner Route
climbs.fa: C. Lattimer and D. Pike. May 2020.

content.description: From the bolts at the top of "Run, you Bastard!", move up and left towards a cave feature. Clip a bolt on the right face and figure out a way to pull into the crack. Once you have established in the corner, the difficulty eases off considerably. Follow the crack up and left, then slab to the two bolt anchor at the top of the formation.
content.protection: One bolt. Single rack to #1 C4. Offset cams could be helpful, but not necessary.
content.location: Alternate second pitch of "Run, you Bastard!"

climbs.name: Baby Steps
climbs.fa: D. Pike, E. Wolfe, and C.Lattimer. May 2020.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb "Run you Bastard!" to the two bolt anchor at the big ledge.

Pitch 2: Follow the bolts on the arete to a 2 bolt anchor at the top of the formation.
